name: clmring

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ CMod, c1 ∈ Ring, c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Ring)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Ring)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, crg))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

comment: The scalar ring of a subcomplex module is a ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
